@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2004-2010 1&1 Internet AG, Germany, http://www.1und1.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Christian Hagendorn (chris_schmidt) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The qx.ui.list.List is based on the virtual infrastructure and supports filtering, sorting, grouping, single selection, multi selection, data binding and custom rendering. Using the virtual infrastructure has considerable advantages when there is a huge amount of model items to render because the virtual infrastructure only creates widgets for visible items and reuses them. This saves both creation time and memory. With the {@link qx.ui.list.core.IListDelegate} interface it is possible to configure the list's behavior (item and group renderer configuration, filtering, sorting, grouping, etc.). Here's an example of how to use the widget: 


 var rawData = [];
 for (var i = 0; i < 2500; i++) {
  rawData[i] = "Item No " + i;
 }
 var model = qx.data.marshal.Json.createModel(rawData);

 var list = new qx.ui.list.List(model);

 var delegate = {
   sorter : function(a, b) {
     return a > b ? 1 : a < b ? -1 : 0;
   }
 };
 list.setDelegate(delegate);

 list.getSelection().push(model.getItem(20));

 list.getSelection().addListener("change", function(e) {
   this.debug("Selection: " + list.getSelection().getItem(0));
 }, this);

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the qx.ui.list.List with the passed model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The path to the property which holds the information that should be displayed as a label. This is only needed if objects are stored in the model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The path to the property which holds the information that should be displayed as an icon. This is only needed if objects are stored in the model and icons should be displayed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The path to the property which holds the information that should be displayed as a group label. This is only needed if objects are stored in the model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A map containing the options for the label binding. The possible keys can be found in the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding} documentation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A map containing the options for the icon binding. The possible keys can be found in the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding} documentation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A map containing the options for the group label binding. The possible keys can be found in the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding} documentation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Delegation object which can have one or more functions defined by the {@link qx.ui.list.core.IListDelegate} interface.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Indicates that the list is managing the {@link #groups} automatically.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Contains all groups for data binding, but do only manipulate the array when the {@link #autoGrouping} is set to false.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Render list items with variable height, calculated from the individual item size.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Array} lookup table to get the model index from a row. To get the correct value after applying filter, sorter, group. Note the value -1 indicates that the value is a group item.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Array} lookup table for getting the group index from the row

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Map} contains all groups with the items as children. The key is the group name and the value is an Array containing each item's model index.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Boolean} indicates when one or more String are used for grouping.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Boolean} indicates when one or more Object are used for grouping.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Boolean} indicates when a default group is used for grouping.
